content.user_title: Build headless CMS applications with Payload in Claude Code
content.value_statement: Payload CMS projects require understanding TypeScript configurations, database adapters, and access control patterns. This skill provides comprehensive documentation for collections, fields, hooks, and security patterns.
actual_capabilities: Collection and field configuration with all Payload field types
Access control patterns including RBAC, multi-tenant, and row-level security
Hook implementation for beforeChange, afterChange, beforeValidate, afterRead
Database adapter configuration for MongoDB, Postgres, and SQLite
Custom endpoint creation with authentication and request handling
Plugin development with TypeScript patterns and package structure
limitations: Does not include frontend React component development guidance
Does not cover deployment or hosting configurations
Does not include GraphQL schema customization beyond basic queries

output_examples.input: How do I create a Posts collection with author relationship?
output: Define collection with slug 'posts' and fields array
Add text field for title with required: true
Add relationship field for author pointing to users collection
Configure admin settings with useAsTitle for display
Add timestamps: true for automatic createdAt and updatedAt

best_practices: Always pass req parameter in hooks for transaction safety with database operations
Set overrideAccess: false when passing user parameter to Local API to enforce permissions
Use context flags in hooks to prevent infinite loops when updating the same document
anti_patterns: Calling payload operations in hooks without passing req breaks transaction atomicity
Passing user to Local API without overrideAccess: false bypasses all access control
Triggering the same hook recursively without context guards causes infinite loops

faq.question: Which database adapters does Payload support?
faq.answer: Payload supports MongoDB, Postgres, SQLite, Vercel Postgres, and Cloudflare D1 SQLite through official adapter packages.

faq.question: What is the maximum relationship depth for queries?
faq.answer: Default depth is 2 levels. Set maxDepth on relationship fields or use depth parameter in queries to control population.

faq.question: How do I integrate Payload with existing Next.js apps?
faq.answer: Payload 3.x installs directly into your Next.js app folder. Configure payload.config.ts and add admin routes to your app directory.

faq.question: Does this skill access my Payload credentials?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains only documentation and code examples. It does not execute code or access environment variables.

faq.question: Why does my access control not work in Local API?
faq.answer: Local API bypasses access control by default. Add overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter to enforce permissions.

faq.question: How does this compare to other CMS skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on Payload CMS 3.x with Next.js integration, TypeScript-first approach, and built-in access control patterns.
